column4: When installing ubuntu in expert mode, how do I partition? As in something like cfdisk? IT wont let me do anything to the partitions that it auto generates or that are already there
you'll need to write the partition table after you make changes.
and then format it as ext4
I don't have thoise options, I just have weirdness such as guided partition that insists on using all of the space
ah dont worry I figured it out, the interface just isnt very intuitive compared to traditional tools such as windows fdisk
